text: Psalm 115
Dead Idols and the Living God
Not to us, O Yahweh, not to us,
but to your name give glory,
because of your loyal love,
because of your faithfulness.
Why should the nations say,
“Where, ⸤pray tell⸥,\f + \fr 115:2 \ft Literally “please” \f* \add is\add* their God?”
But our God \add is\add* in the heavens;
all that he desires, he does.
Their idols \add are\add* silver and gold,
\add the\add* work of human hands.
They have mouths, but cannot speak;
they have eyes, but cannot see;
they have ears, but cannot hear;
they have noses, but cannot smell;
\add they have\add* their hands, but they cannot feel,
their feet, but they cannot walk;
they cannot utter a sound in their throats.
\add Those who\add* make them become like them,
\add as does\add* everyone who trusts in them.
O Israel, trust Yahweh;
he \add is\add* their help and their shield.
O house of Aaron, trust in Yahweh;
he \add is\add* their help and their shield.
\add You who\add* fear Yahweh, trust in Yahweh;
he \add is\add* their help and their shield.
Yahweh remembers us; he will bless \add us\add*.
He will bless the house of Israel;
he will bless the house of Aaron.
He will bless \add those who\add* fear Yahweh,
the small with the great.
May Yahweh give you increase,
you and your children.
May you be blessed by Yahweh,
who made heaven and earth.
The heavens \add are\add* Yahweh’s heavens,
but the earth he has given to \add the\add* children of humankind.
The dead do not praise Yah,\f + \fr 115:17 \ft A shortened form of “Yahweh” \f*
nor any descending into silence.
\add It is\add* we, we will bless Yah\f + \fr 115:18 \ft A shortened form of “Yahweh” \f*
from now until forever.
Praise Yah!\f + \fr 115:18 \ft Hebrew \fqa hallelujah \ft  \f*
